skillTree.localised_description: Furtive, scheming, sly, cunning, underhand, devious, conniving, double-dealing, and sneaky - valuable traits if you wish to stay alive!
All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.
Slipping from covering and darting towards his foes, Lurklox throws all the weight of his charge behind the shots coming from the weapons surgically attached to his hands.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic cost: -30% for Lore of Stealth spells
	(Heroes in local region)

Attribute: Vanguard Deployment
	(armies in local owned region)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: Lurklox prefers to manipulate others to do his bidding, as he had always been loath to reveal himself. As such, his effects are felt on the battlefield through indirect means, rather than direct. Which is not to say his impact is anything less than extraordinary.

effects.description:
Enemy Hero action success chance: -50%
	(enemy characters in region)

Attribute: Flanking Immune
	(Heroes in local region)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit takes no penalties when flanked.

effects.description:
Attribute: Expert Charge Defence
	(Heroes in local region)

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

effects.description:
Attribute: Charge Reflection
	(Heroes in local region)

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.

skillTree.localised_description: Lurklox laughs at the weakling schemes of the Changeling, so petty and pitiful compared to the grand changes wrought by the Master of All Deceptions.

effects.description:
Enemy casualty replenishment rate: -100%
	(enemy armies in local region)

Enemy leadership: -8
	(enemy armies in local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Unbeaten, unbroken, unbowed. That is how Lurklox would describe himself should any more ask for his prowess in melee combat. He would likely then demonstrate by killing the impertinent rodent who had asked the question.

enabled_if: Enemy Lord or Hero presence in ability range.

skillTree.localised_description: Any who dare to grasp onto the winds of magic in the presence of Lurklox find that such action was deeply foolish, serving only to channel more energy into the Master of all Deceptions.

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: Lurklox's presence can be felt in every aspect of life, and haunts those who feel his presence in the region. Such is Lurklox's goal, disrupting all who dare cross his path.

effects.description:
Ability: "Looming of Lurklox"
	(enemy armies in local region)

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit takes no penalties when flanked.
Witnessing other friendly units rout will only affect this unit's leadership if they also have the Contempt attribute.
A unit with Executioner will execute units in combat below a 20% hit points threshold.
Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.
Entities with this attribute ignore the effects of enemy contact effects such as  Poison
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: So much of war is an art. Over time and with much practice, combat moves can resemble a series of perfectly-rehearsed dance moves.
This being fights dirty, no honour system applies here!
"Stay in one place, gods-damn you!"
Whether a targeted slice to the throat, or a precision stab to the heart, this one knows how to kill!
"The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."
Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
Always on the lookout for an opening or advantage in battle - somewhere to put the knife in…
The harder they hit, the more they commit, the easier it is to strike back.
A drawn blade should not be put away until slaked in blood.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Death is always just a shot away.
By its very nature, being good at killing requires that you are equally adept at not dying.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +15% chance of wounding aggressors

Enemy Hero action success chance: -15%
	(enemy characters in region)

skillTree.localised_description: Those in the army can find succour or be replenished by the power of this champion.

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of this warrior, their stature, import or infamy, can have a calming effect.

Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: "If they know I'm coming then more's the better!"

skillTree.localised_description: A skilled assassin is a cold-hearted killer and merciless murderer.
Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

Daemonic units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is low.
	
	Daemonic units also have:
	Physical Resistance
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

items.colour_text: Lurklox plays a great many games with the mortal realms, but sometimes he is enticed to say nothing more than "no".

ui_effects.localised_text: Redirects projectiles back towards the firing unit

items.colour_text: The grim presence of a warpstone artefact in the hands of a greater daemon of the Horned Rat should terrify all who have the knowledge to understand what that means. The two together makes the giant denizen of the Realm of Ruin all but unstoppable.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit.

effects.description:
Campaign movement range: +15%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Lurklox is the Verminlord of Clan Eshin and a member of the Shadow Council of Thirteen. Cloaked in shadow, Lurklox was one of the Deceivers – a Verminlord steeped in treachery and master of the art of the silent kill. Lurklox preferred to manipulate others to do his bidding, as he had always been loath to reveal himself. However, when all else failed – or when he wished to send a clear message to a foe – Lurklox was not above joining open battle. Indeed, such things were good for his reputation, as others could see the Verminlord unveiled in all his fury. Under normal conditions, any who saw Lurklox did not live to tell of it.
